bullets.text: Fed approves Banco Inter, S.A. application, signaling regulatory clearance for cross-border banking expansion and potential competitive shifts in U.S. financial services.
Fed releases December 2025 G.17 industrial production/capacity data and updates Enhanced Financial Accounts, refreshing signals on output momentum, utilization, and sector balance sheets.
BEA Q3 2025 U.S. international investment position update reframes external financing needs, cross-border income flows, and dollar vulnerability via changes in net foreign assets/liabilities.
Trump’s renewed pressure on Powell and Fed-chair jockeying (e.g., Warsh vs. Hassett) increases perceived political risk to monetary independence, potentially lifting term premia.
U.S. tariffs floated alongside Greenland takeover rhetoric, plus congressional outreach to Denmark, elevate Arctic geopolitics and raise trade-war tail risks with Europe.
Canada-China tariff deal, including moves affecting Chinese EVs, shifts North American trade dynamics and could accelerate Chinese EV market access via Canada.
Venezuela oil reportedly fetching ~30% higher after an initial $500M sale underscores sanctions-driven scarcity premia and could reshape Caribbean supply, including Cuba’s outlook.
Mitsubishi’s $7.5B acquisition of U.S. shale gas assets highlights durable global demand for U.S. LNG feedgas and energy-security-driven upstream M&A.
Largest U.S. offshore wind project resumes after a judge lifts suspension, reducing near-term policy uncertainty for renewables developers and supply-chain contractors.
OpenAI testing ads in ChatGPT and committing billions to chip deals signals a pivot toward ad-based AI monetization and intensifies competition for scarce compute.
Google appeals the U.S. search monopoly case, extending antitrust uncertainty over search distribution and ad pricing, with long-dated implications for Big Tech valuation.
Education Department pauses/delays defaulted student-loan collections, easing household cash-flow pressure short term but increasing uncertainty around fiscal and credit policy enforcement.
New study finds no link between prenatal acetaminophen use and autism, reducing a major public-health concern and potentially lowering litigation and prescribing uncertainty.
NASA brings Crew-11 home early via rare medical evacuation, highlighting operational risk management for long-duration missions and dependence on reliable crew-return capability.
